page.title: 16The Sibthorpe Fishponds
page.content: In Sibthorpe,at both Bottom and Top Green ,there are some depressions and ditches.Although they do not create much immediate interest,they are in fact{historic fishponds.}These ponds were created in medieval times by monks inhabitting the nearby monastry. The ponds were made in around 1200 AD and are bedded with flint.The ponds were used to keep carp for the monks. When the carp had reached a sufficient size, the monks ate them for food.The fishponds were created before the dovecote was errected,and the fishponds share a field with it.{ Although most of the water has dissapeared from the channels,one small pond still contains water.It has contained water for nearly 700 years.It is a pond placed in the centre of a square of channel.The fields where they stand are strange.
